meanings.definition: The process of becoming a fossil.
meanings.sent1: Fossilization takes many years to happen.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study fossilization to learn about ancient life forms.
meanings.sent3: The dinosaur chuckled at the thought of its own fossilization.
meanings.sent4: The museum displayed the fossilization of a prehistoric plant as a frozen moment in time.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by the fossilization of a giant dinosaur skeleton.

meanings.definition: The act of preserving or being preserved in a fossil.
meanings.sent1: The fossilization of the ancient leaf was a rare find.
meanings.sent2: The fossilization of the fish showed intricate details of its scales.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel joked about its own fossilization in a tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The fossilization of the seashell was like capturing a piece of history.
meanings.sent5: The fossilization of the insect in amber amazed the researchers.

meanings.definition: The state of being transformed into a fossil.
meanings.sent1: The fossilization of the bone revealed the creature's size.
meanings.sent2: The fossilization of the tree stump showed its growth rings.
meanings.sent3: The comedian made a joke about his own fossilization in a comedy club.
meanings.sent4: The fossilization of the leaf was a snapshot of its life in ancient times.
meanings.sent5: The fossilization of the trilobite was a marvel of nature's preservation.
